about.name: Sam Forbush
about.title: Student at Boston College
about.bio: Sam Forbush is a student at Boston College. He is a CS major and Math minor, with a primary interest in software development. He graduated from Algonquin Regional High School in 2019 and is expected to graduate from BC in 2023.

projects.title: Portfolio Website
projects.description: This ongoing project, which was first completed for Web Application Development, is a portfolio website created using HTML, CSS, and JS through the platform Glitch and hosted on Github pages. It can be easily adjusted and updated due to iterative rendering.

projects.title: Generation and Evaluation of Poetic Language
projects.description: With partner Dyson Ye, the goal of this project was to generate convincing poetic language from limited data and with little to no supervision. The methods for generation include a charactere level LSTM model and the Hafez model. Along the way, we tested the ability of existing computational evaluators on generated poetry. Link to full poster:

projects.title: Social Contagion of University Divestment
projects.description: This project analyzes the difference between the Apartheid and fossil fuel divestment movements through the lense of social contagion. Complex contagion is also used to measure the differences between university administration "sensitivity" to student concerns. Link to full report:

projects.title: Rod Cell Simulation
projects.description: This project, completed in 2019, simulates the distribution of rod cells in the human eye, taking into account the expected proportion of colored rods. It was developed in Ocaml as a part of the Computer Science 1 Honors program at Boston College. As shown, the cells are not completely randomly distributed, as there is approximately even space between any two neighboring cells. This was done to make a more realistic simulation, as the cells in the human eye are also approximately evenly spaced.
